content: This iconic tower, completed in 1930, was once the tallest building in the world and remains a symbol of New York City. What is it called?

That's an easy one! It's the Empire State Building. I've seen so many pictures and movies featuring it; it's hard to imagine New York without it. The way it stands tall against the skyline is just breathtaking. I remember learning that it was built during the Great Depression, and its construction provided jobs to thousands of people. It's not only an architectural marvel but also a symbol of hope and resilience. What's your favorite thing about the Empire State Building?
